channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I.C.C. Issues Arrest Warrants for 2 Senior Russian Security Officials
item.description: Sergei K. Shoigu, a former defense minister, and Gen. Valery V. Gerasimov, the country’s highest-ranking military officer, were accused of directing attacks against civilians in Ukraine.

item.title: Live Updates: Casualties Reported as Police Fire on Protesters in Kenya
item.description: Demonstrators breached the Parliament building to protest the passage of a bill that raises taxes. At least four people were shot, one fatally, the independent Kenya Human Rights Commission said.

item.title: Stellantis threatens to kill production in the UK, saying the country has set sales targets for electric cars way too high
item.description: Managing director Maria Grazia Davino said Stellantis would be forced to make discounts to meet the targets.

item.title: Russia Committed Human Rights Violations in Crimea, European Court Finds
item.description: The European Court of Human Rights listed multiple violations. Its findings paint a grim picture of life under a decade of Russian occupation.

item.title: Russia Committed Human Rights Violations in Crimea, European Court Finds
item.description: The European Court of Human Rights listed multiple violations. Its findings paint a grim picture of life under a decade of Russian occupation.

item.title: Portfolio manager known for ‘The Big Short’ isn’t worried about Nvidia sell-off: ‘I don’t think it means anything’
item.description: Nvidia was still up 139% this year through Monday’s close.

item.title: Israel’s Supreme Court Rules Ultra-Orthodox Jews Must Be Drafted Into Military
item.description: The court ruled there was no legal justification for the ultra-Orthodox exemption from service, a decision that threatened to split Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s wartime government.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Half a Million in Gaza Face Starvation, Report Says
item.description: A U.N.-backed panel of experts said Israel’s war in Gaza had created a catastrophic lack of food, but stopped short of declaring a famine in the territory.

item.title: Chili’s offers lifetime supply of free burgers
item.description: Among the runner-up prizes? A BurgerTime Arcade cabinet.

item.title: Some States Say They Can’t Afford Ozempic and Other Weight Loss Drugs
item.description: Public employees in West Virginia who took the drugs lost weight and were healthier, and some are despondent that the state is canceling a program to help pay for them.

item.title: Israel’s Supreme Court Rules Ultra-Orthodox Jews Must Be Drafted Into Military
item.description: The court ruled there was no legal justification for the ultra-Orthodox exemption from service, a decision that threatened to split Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s wartime government.

item.title: Prepping for the ‘unthinkable,’ Norway is stockpiling 30,000 tons of grain, citing the war in Ukraine, the pandemic, and climate change
item.description: The Scandinavian country stopped storing grain in 2003, but following Russia's 2022 invasion of Ukraine began reconsidering the program.

item.title: Kenyan-Led Forces Arrive in Haiti After Months of Gang Violence
item.description: The first wave of a 2,500-member international force sent to restore order in the gang-plagued Caribbean nation has arrived, but critics worry the plan will fail.

item.title: Kenyan-Led Forces Arrive in Haiti After Months of Gang Violence
item.description: The first wave of a 2,500-member international force sent to restore order in the gang-plagued Caribbean nation has arrived, but critics worry the plan will fail.

item.title: Tesla issues its fourth Cybertruck recall in seven months because parts of the six-figure EV can come loose
item.description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration announced Tuesday the recall may affect more than 11,000 trucks.
